critique: This is an executive order from 1937 exempting a specific individual from mandatory retirement. It's a fairly narrow action with limited implications for broader political issues. It doesn't touch on immigration, civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. It does relate to executive power, as it uses the President's authority to make an exception to a rule. It also has a slight federalism aspect, as it concerns a federal employee. There is no ideological tilt.
